conditions: buck-boost and the ACGATE are disabled
buck-boost and the ACGATE are disabled
ADC and watchdog timer and ACGATE driver are disabled
ADC and ACGATE driver are disabled
ADC and watchdog timer are enabled

pins.name: VNTC
pins.description: Battery temperature-sense bias. The VNTC pin is the voltage bias of the NTC comparator’s resistor divider for both the feedback NTC voltage and reference NTC voltage.

pins.name: NTC
pins.description: Negative temperature coefficient (NTC) thermistor pin. The NTC pin is the battery temperature sense’s input.

pins.name: NTC
pins.description: Negative temperature coefficient (NTC) thermistor pin. The NTC pin is the battery temperature sense’s input.

pins.name: ACOK
pins.description: Input power good (PG) indication. This pin is an open-drain output that indicates whether the adapter is present. Connect this pin to a voltage source through a resistor.

pins.name: BATT
pins.description: Battery pin. BATT is the battery’s positive terminal.

pins.name: BST2
pins.description: Bootstrap. Connect a 100nF bootstrap capacitor between the BST2 and SW2 pins to form a floating supply across the power MOSFET driver. This drives the power MOSFET’s gate above the supply voltage

pins.name: SW2
pins.description: Switching node. SW2 is the middle point of the boost phase’s half-bridge.

pins.name: SW1
pins.description: Switching node. SW1 is the middle point of the buck phase’s half-bridge

pins.name: IN
pins.description: Input. The IN pin is the IC’s power stage input.

pins.name: BST1
pins.description: Bootstrap. Connect a 100nF bootstrap capacitor between the BST1 and SW1 pins to form a floating supply across the power MOSFET driver. This drives the power MOSFET’s gate above the supply voltage

pins.name: ACGATE
pins.description: Input N-channel MOSFET gate driver. The ACGATE pin drives the external pass-through N-channel MOSFET.

conditions: Connect beween ACGATE and the external N-channel pass-through MOSFET's source

pins.name: ADP
pins.description: Adapter voltage sense. If ADP over-voltage lockout (OVLO) is triggered, the external OVP MOSFET (if used) and power stage turn off. The ADP pin also provides the IC’s internal bias voltage.

pins.name: FB
pins.description: Feedback. In source mode, FB is the IN output voltage in source mode (VIN_SRC) feedback pin. If VIN_SRC feedback is configured via the register, this pin is not functional. Float FB or connect it to AGND.
